intro: Gilia brandegeei var. lambornii, commonly known as the Lamborn's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. This variety is distinguished by its unique floral morphology and is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
